titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Religion apart from the check of history runs to superstition. History divorced from religion lacks its ultimate solution.

I motored in to Durham with Ella, & presided at a meeting of the Preventive & Rescue Association. We returned to Auckland for lunch.

Later, I motored to Newcastle, & dined with the Northern Branch of the Royal Institute of British Architects at Tilley's Restaurant. I proposed the toast of the evening, & made a foolish speech. It was responded to by M
Walter Tapper, the President of the Institute. A bad dinner & worse speeches! I got back to the Castle about 10 minutes before midnight.
